assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Ubuntu/10.10 Chromium/10.0.648.133 Chrome/10.0.648.133 Safari/534.16 Build Identifier:
Is calling abort() really the best way to handle an allocation error?

Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Select and move a large number o messages to another folder Actual Results: See stack above.
Expected Results: They move, life goes on.

How about a stack trace of the correct thread this time:
